eshmun.gui.kripke.utils

Class LogicTextPane.ParseTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • eshmun.gui.kripke.utils.LogicTextPane.ParseTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
    Enclosing class:
    LogicTextPane

    private static class LogicTextPane.ParseTask
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This class represents a ParseTask, that is a task that runs in the background with the objective of parsing and formatting the text in the given textPane, the task also takes care of underlining matching parenthesis when needed (depending on the caret's position).
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kinan Dak Al Bab

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int RUN_INTERVAL
      The interval between each execution of this task and the next one in milliseconds, should be at least equal to WAIT_DURATION or greater.
      private LogicTextPane textPane
      The textPane this task belongs to.
      private static int WAIT_DURATION
      The amount of time after the user's last change that must be guaranteed to pass before the parsing takes place, in milliseconds.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ParseTask(LogicTextPane textPane)
      Create a new ParseTask for the given textPane.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      The method that gets executed in the background each TIME_INTERVAL.
      void caret()
      This method looks near the caret, if there exist a parenthesis it gets underlined with its matching opposite parenthesis, the method clears old parenthesis underlines.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • caret

        public void caret()
        This method looks near the caret, if there exist a parenthesis it gets underlined with its matching opposite parenthesis, the method clears old parenthesis underlines.
